column4: Hey, how would I make the windows equivalent of a file sharing server thing?
Like where I can have a shared folder on my network that my laptop can access?
No, I wanted the windows equivalent of a server on _ubuntu_.
well, some of them do. I did
Samba is the typical answer. I've never used samba, so I can't help you with specifics.
Yes, SSH allows you to securely access a computer's CLI remotely.

You need to create an SSH key on the client computer. It has 2 halves - the public half goes in ~/.ssh/authorized_keys on the remote computer (you'll need some kind of pre-existing access to do that, or ask the owner of the computer). Then just run `ssh 192.168.0.x` (or any IP/hostname) to login.
The remote computer (server) must have sshd running and properly configured for you to gain access. There are plenty of excellent tutorials on both server- and client-side configuration out there.
I'm not quite sure what you mean... you can't get the desktop to connect to your wireless network?
you were having some wifi problem, weren't you? Did you fix it?
Nope. I think since the laptop is booting off of a live usb and the proper drivers aren't installed, the wifi isn't appearing.
Entirely possible. You can install the drivers to get wifi on the laptop working though... it wouldn't be permanent though. But why are you using a LiveUSB instead of installing it? O.o
My laptop absolutely detests anything but that-which-shall-remain-unnamed.
